description: Two sharks are depicted in the ocean, one near the surface, the other deeper. A small orange fish is shown near the bottom left corner, apparently unnoticed. The scene highlights the absurdity of applying human social rituals, specifically a pick-up line, to the brutal, instinct-driven environment of a predatory feeding frenzy among sharks. This juxtaposition creates irony by contrasting the expected behavior of sharks with a polite, almost romantic, social query. The situation is notable for placing a human-like social interaction within a marine predatory context.
caption: "Say, honey . . . didn't I meet you last night at the feeding frenzy?"
